page.title: 16GOVERNMENT IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: Northwold parish comprises Northwold ward and Whittington ward,the two villages being approximately 2 miles apart.The Northwold Parish Council is composed of 11 Parish Councillors from both wards,3 District Councillors and one County Councillor.The Parish Council,which holds regular meetings in the village hall on the first Tuesday of each month,is responsible for many aspects of village life for example adequate street lighting,the recording of burials and the maintenance of the burial grounds.It will also consider and comment upon planning applications for buildings within the village,but approval can only be granted by the Borough Council at Kings Lynn.It also ensures that the various footpaths are kept in a proper state,although the Borough Council is responsible for any clearance needed.
